ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about Spanish and Hispanoamerican culture in this class as well as collaborative and communicative skills. I developed insights on new vocabulary and reading proficiency skills in Spanish. I deeply enjoyed the discussions and projects we had in class! The novels and cultural events were inspiring and made me think and learn in new and different ways.

Most prominently, this course allowed me to improve reading comprehension. I enjoyed many of the short works and novels read in this class. This course seemed to be slightly less focused on grammar and more focused on the importance of conversation and written analysis, which is a critical skill that I was able to develop. I believe I am more confident in Spanish conversation and writing following this course.
I greatly improved my Spanish grammar and my speaking skills by taking this course.
I learned how to improve my Spanish.
I improved my Spanish while enjoying the classes very much indeed.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of this course were collaboration and professor engagement/energy. I enjoyed attending her office hours and speaking with her on ways to improve. I cannot think of how this class could be improved!

Strengths include quality of content explored (good movies, shorts, and readings). Many of which expanded my knowledge not only of the Spanish language, but also global issues and different cultures. There werent too many weaknesses, but class often felt monotonous. Each class seemed to follow the same routine which can lower engagement in a class that meets so often. To improve the course, I would have liked to explore some new grammar topics. This course explored nearly identical grammar topics as SPAN 120.

Strengths: there are many different, creative assignments which are pretty fun to do. Also, clarification on grammar and/or feedback was super helpful.
Weaknesses: definitely a pretty sizeable workload.
Juliana was an excellent teacher. Her instruction and passion garnered involvement from every student.

Strength:  fun of learning, variety of course content.

Weakness: not enough pressure to actually study vocab. Maybe more small tests for vocab.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to other students looking to improve their Spanish reading and writing proficiency skills. It was truly wonderful being engaged with this class and collaborating with my peers. I thought this course was structured very well to inspire learning. I look forward to continuing Spanish next semester as well!
I definitely would recommend this for any student looking to improve their speaking and comprehension skills.
Yes! I feel this course makes you far better at conversational Spanish without overwhelming students with work. It was generally enjoyable.

Yes! One note, however: similar to many of the classes here at Yale (but especially relevant to this one) is that you only get out of the course what you put into it. It is critical to be ready to engage during class and with the homework assignments in order to improve.
As long as Juliana is teaching it, I would. She made the class fun, but never failed to challenge her students.
